did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: St. John's Episcopal Church of Canandaigua records, 1816-1892.

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: St. John's Episcopal Church of Canandaigua (Canandaigua, N.Y.)

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Two volumes of warden's and vestrymen's meeting minutes; four volumes of membership information; one volume of accounts for the construction of the church and a pamphlet entitled "The Protestant Episcopal Pulpit" containing the transcriptions of two sermons.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: On September 27, 1814 the parish of St. John's was formed by the organization of "the wardens and vestrymen of St. John's Church in Canandaigua under the supervision of Bishop J.H. Hobart." The parish's first church building was consecrated December 12, 1816, but as soon as 1822, debt forced the society to advertise it for sale. A gift of $1500 by the Trinity Church of New York City, and an additional $5000 subscribed by members and friends of the church made its sale unnecessary. In 1873 this church was demolished and a new one was constructed.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: One volume of warden's and vestrymen's meeting minutes (1837-1869), one volume of annual warden's and vestrymen's meeting minutes (1857-1859); four volumes of membership information (1834-1849, 1816-1835, 1816-1869, 1863-1892); one volume of accounts for the construction of the church (1816-1817) and a pamphlet entitled "The Protestant Episcopal Pulpit" containing the transcriptions of two sermons.
